pros: Great staff to work with
cons: I have nothing bad to say

review_title: Multiple travelers have told me that this is the worst hospital they’ve ever worked for.
job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Naples, FL
pros: Coworkers are friendly and help each other as much as possible.
cons: Unsafe staffing ratios (ICU RN’s regularly have 3 ICU patients or 4 unstable stepdown patients, floor nurses have had as many as 9-1 ratio), no PCT’s in the ICU and always short on the floor so Baker Acts often have sitters removed prematurely and patients end up restrained, HR department doesn’t answer their phone nor support their staff. There’s only one ICU MD working during the day who covers 3 different ICU’s, plus a stepdown unit, who is frequently unavailable and regularly leaves one nurse practitioner to cover in their absence - who is overwhelmed and so is not receptive to concerns regarding patient conditions. Hospitalists are friendly but also have a high patient load and so end up missing basic things like restarting home meds, rarely update patients and families, and opt to keep stable patients in the ICU rather than trust the floor nurses due to their patient ratios being so high.  Patients are neglected and staff are unhappy and unappreciated, high staff turnover rate. Supplies are outdated and most of the beds are broken, subpar cleanliness.

pros: Benefits ok Got my hours every week and OT
cons: Don’t recommend. For profit hospital and it shows. There 4 months and had to get out.

pros: Not a bad place but they seam to pay new hires more then seasoned employees. Pay not at cost living
cons: Annual merit increase always below 3%.

job_title: Office Assistant in Pine Ridge, FL
pros: Nice place to work, good environment.
cons: Always seen to be under staff

job_title: Maintenance Mechanic II in Naples, FL
pros: Friendly staff. Good location in Naples
cons: No room to grow. Can easily be max at pay

pros: Great place to work, great facilities and nice staff
cons: Long hours, low pay for this particular position

job_title: Medical Staff Coordinator in Naples, FL
pros: Good benefits and great teams to work with.
cons: Small department with limited opportunities for growth. Manager/s in this and other departments are always stressed and working extra hours to meet expectations.

pros:
They offer benefits to both full time and part time employees. 

The director is about the most decent person you could ever imagine.

Work from home is great.
cons:
You have a such a high level of micromanagement that managers should just have to do the work themselves. Every call, every keystroke and every screen is 100% recorded forever.

If a patient mentions symptoms such as hiccups or they sneezed last Tuesday, you are required to open the symptom classification list and see if the hiccups or sneezing are listed (those symptoms are obviously not listed). If not, you will be notified during the random check you missed it and penalized. 

The doctors that you have successfully set up appoints for, you have to open the profile and must be reviewing it before you make an appointment, otherwise they will know. You will be punished for memorizing, they do not trust you. I felt like they completely ignored my experience. 

The worst part of the job is patients who have to call over and over and over again to get the care they deserve. Most doctors are completely professional and do call, however, there are doctors / nurses who never call patients back. Patients deserve to be called back by someone. Most of the offices will never pick up the phone either. When I worked in another department they ALWAYS picked up the phone. That is an issue because it means they do not want to deal with patients.

pros: Easy Job in the summer, overwhelming in the winter
cons:
Lots of turnaround
low pay hard to negotiate for a higher wage

pros: Everything is antiquated. No redundancy
cons: No redundancy, peers have to figure out how to do things the correct way.

pros: My department has wonderful team
cons: Long hoursMy department has wonderful team players

review_title: I would give it 0 stars if I could!  Terrible place to work!
pros: Regular hours, sick and vacation time, 401k
cons: This place is a joke.  So called team leaders play favorites and create a hostile work environment.  Directors bully those under them.  My team was flat out told by our director to "quit complaining" when we brought up issues and that she "would like to replace the whole team" if she could.  The ER and Outpatient areas are so short staffed as to be critical.  People quit every week--they literally can not pay people to work here.  Check the reviews and think twice before you accept any job here.

pros: seasonal pay is great, fellow staff RNs are pretty great to work with
cons: Management, high patient acuity, understaffed aides and RNs most of the time, for those who are FT core nurses there is low salary pay with little to no chance for improvement/raise in salary unless you reapply as seasonal. no incentives, only shift differentials

review_title: Nice small Hospital that is very patient focused.
pros: Benefits are good.  You develop a good working relationship with the physicians.  Less stress than working in a trauma center.
cons: Management is very focused on the bottom line which means short staffing and lots of call.  There is little time for staff education and the quality of care suffers at times.   No career ladder in place.

pros: Beautiful hospital thanks to Cleveland Clinic
cons: Patients have to know there is very little staff to give you good care because they work on a "grid" meaning working with as little staff as possible.  When you ring your light there probably will not be a staff member available to answer it because the one nurse available is busy helping another patient.  Unhappy nurses off season unable to pay their bills because they are always being cancelled, however, they still hire agency nurses who have to be paid and cant be cancelled because they are on contract. Take care of your staff first.

pros: I can't really list any
cons: Insurance cost is too high, staff gets verbally abused by the patients and nothing is done about it, Dr's cannot provide quality care because it's all about numbers and meeting the goals, the call center is the absolute worst, management gossips and puts employees against each other, low pay, messages regarding lab results and test results do not get answered by the nurses, patient care is horrible, refills do not get done for about a week, does not care about employees and their families.  Just a downright horrible place to work.  If you are even thinking about applying or becoming a patient here, please....I beg you....go somewhere else.

pros: Many great changes have been made over the last 2 years. Administration cares about and is listening to the employees. Family environment with very friendly staff. Service lines have expanded and it is exciting to work for a progressive thinking organization. This is the best healthcare system in Naples, no doubt!
cons: During "season" it can be extremely busy and at times overcrowded.

review_title: Nice Atmosphere for a Hospital Environment

pros: Caring healthcare providers who actually love providing healthcare, from physicians to administrative staff.
cons: Senior management will take credit where they can, and avoid accountability everywhere else. Annual employee surveys consistently show that staff does not trust leadership, and many physicians have left due to inability to work with the executive leadership.

cons: Too many people in the administrative department managing.  Having clinical managers for the RN's, LPN's and MA's that had no clinical medical background.
